definition: tradition or style from the past/old ways/surviving tradition/relic
to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)

sentences.english: Where we are now seems like a hangover of that period.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在的情形仿佛就是那个时期的遗风。

sentences.english: It was survivals of the mediaeval sanctuaries.
sentences.chinese: 它是中世纪庇护所的遗风。

sentences.english: The client also should abide by mediaeval relic, can cut with a knives only feed.
sentences.chinese: 顾客也要遵循中古遗风，只能用一把刀子切食。

sentences.english: That fashion is a survival from thes.
sentences.chinese: 那种时装是世纪年代的遗风。

sentences.english: Tibetan costumes and head adornments have kept the styles handed down by Tibetans' hunting ancestors.
sentences.chinese: 藏族服饰和头饰艺术保留着祖先猎人时代的装饰遗风。

sentences.english: This is partly the legacy of the Soviet era, she said.
sentences.chinese: 这部分的归因于苏联时代的遗风，她说。
胡佛留下的遗风毁誉参半。

definition: vestigial residue/a throwback (to a former age)
the Book of Songs 書經|书经[Shu1 jing1] and Classic of Rites 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4]/a cultured well-read person
to be both a farmer and a scholar/to work the land and also undertake academic studies
interest/point of particular charm and interest
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
to follow old patterns/to imitate existing models/to continue along the same lines
